name: TheAtlantic
text: "Young Abraham Lincoln argued that defiance of the law endangers us all. His point was that one cannot claim to support the rule of law while also ignoring it," @NPRinskeep writes: https://t.co/RiWgINQeYx

name: TheAtlantic
text: "No one should feign surprise or disbelief that academics write to me with great frequency to share their anxieties. In a three-week period early this summer, I counted some 150 of these messages," @JohnHMcWhorter writes: https://t.co/KCPsIO370J

name: TheAtlantic
text: Herd immunity is a concept that guides vaccine policy to prevent outbreaks, writes @JamesHamblin. It is not an approach to ending a global pandemic. https://t.co/nfSRRCtLLX

name: TheAtlantic
text: In defeating Joe Kennedy, long-serving Massachusetts senator Ed Markey turned his biggest vulnerability into an opportunity, @russellberman writes: https://t.co/2GqP7E0S5b

name: TheAtlantic
text: Twenty-five years ago in Beijing, @HillaryClinton declared that "women's rights are human rights." Here’s the full speech as she delivered it. https://t.co/dPOsQ96L1p

name: TheAtlantic
text:
While COVID-19 researchers have extolled the virtues of masks and the necessity of ventilation, "another behavioral tactic hasn’t received enough attention, in part because it makes itself known by its absence," @DKThomp writes. "That tactic is silence."
https://t.co/fWQebB8iqU

name: TheAtlantic
text: Publishing student writing shifts students from consumers to creators of stories. LaQuisha Hall, a Baltimore educator, has guided more than 100 students to becoming published authors, @mdawriter reports: https://t.co/XBQlzGKF1w

name: TheAtlantic
text: This year’s national reckoning over policing means that more Americans could stand to seriously listen to the music of Drakeo the Ruler and other young rappers who have been incarcerated, Hannah Giorgis writes. https://t.co/mgEXX0TrKu

name: TheAtlantic
text: Publishing student writing shifts students from consumers to creators of stories. LaQuisha Hall, a Baltimore educator, has guided more than 100 students to becoming published authors, @mdawriter reports: https://t.co/Be3zNIRlFJ

name: TheAtlantic
text: We’re more than six months—and 6 million cases—into the U.S. coronavirus outbreak. Our reporters offer updates on the progress of a few different preventive efforts. The latest Atlantic Daily, by @mimbsy: https://t.co/ft6gVw1D7T

name: TheAtlantic
text: "For all the deserved media attention on the times an individual ends the life of another, little is said when the target of a person’s violence is himself, a far more common occurrence," @ChrisMurphyCT writes: https://t.co/wMldLE3MM0

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @JeffreyGoldberg: .@JimCarrey: "[R]elying on jokes can sometimes cancel out the seriousness of what you’re trying to say. At this moment, the best anyone can offer is gallows humor...."

Read his whole piece in @TheAtlantic:
https://t.co/xTu0azGmET

name: TheAtlantic
text: Trump's presidency has been a whirlwind of chaos—and that's a major obstacle to convincing Americans he can stabilize their lives, @RonBrownstein writes: https://t.co/qTt2J8307n

name: TheAtlantic
text: “The schools decided what they’re going to do, and the parents are in a panic.” Parents who can't work from home are struggling with a lack of child care, report @olgakhazan and @AdamHSays: https://t.co/66UD92flOH

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @Saahil_Desai: "A lot of the money that well-off people aren’t spending right now is money that lower-paid people would normally receive as income." https://t.co/2PTgYGBLOu

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @jpinsk: There's "just nothing to spend money on," one well-paid man told me. 

My latest in @TheAtlantic is about the super-savers of the pandemic: 
https://t.co/C656mODrKf

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @YAppelbaum: When viral incidents lead to pressure for reform, police often respond by pulling back—and then when crime spikes, support for reform wanes. @AlecMacGillis looks at what mayors and activists do in the face of such pullbacks: https://t.co/jftPnlUmcR

name: TheAtlantic
text: "America has always been redeemed by those who challenge it to do better. Today, some true patriots refuse to stand for an anthem that has never stood for all Americans, challenging the country to live up to its ideals," @JimCarrey writes: https://t.co/dPVrz0WhYo

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Rather than scrap the filibuster … the Democrats may want to instead consider reforming the procedure, so that it continues to exist for truly extraordinary circumstances, but ceases to be the easily deployed blockade it is today," @NormOrnstein writes: https://t.co/bfKAguH1W9

name: TheAtlantic
text: There’s a weird thrill to getting lost inside Charlie Kaufman's mind-bending new film on Netflix, "I’m Thinking of Ending Things." @davidlsims on the psychological-horror drama where nothing is as it seems: https://t.co/buzgmni35P

name: TheAtlantic
text: “New hires and young people who work remotely risk remaining unknown quantities,” @amandamull writes. “And unknown quantities don’t become beloved colleagues, or get promoted.” https://t.co/xTV1XXxR3P
